solution_line_template: If each carriage had another {additional_seats_per_carriage} seats, each carriage would have {initial_seats_per_carriage} + {additional_seats_per_carriage} = {new_seats_per_carriage} seats.

The train comprises of {carriages_per_train} carriages and each carriage now has {new_seats_per_carriage} seats; therefore a train has {new_seats_per_carriage} x {carriages_per_train} = <<{carriages_per_train}*{new_seats_per_carriage}={seats_per_train}>>{seats_per_train} seats.
{num_trains} trains with {seats_per_train} seats each in total can take up {num_trains} x {seats_per_train} = <<{num_trains}*{seats_per_train}={total_passengers}>>{total_passengers} passengers.
